description: Three storey rear extension, single storey garage to rear and installation of railings to front elevation.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plan: TCON2/OD11 (Rev: C) and TCON2/OD12 (Rev: C).  Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the existing materials. 	 Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings in accordance with the Council's adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) policies LV 7.4 and 7B, policies 1.1 (g), 1.2 (f) and 2.10 of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012) and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan Consolidated (2015). | No part of the roof of the single storey side extension (garage) shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties and the visual appearance of the area, in accordance with the Council's adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) policies LV 7.4 and 7B, policies 1.1 (g) and 2.10 of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012) and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan Consolidated (2015). | The side window on the western elevation, in the three storey rear and side infill extension hereby approved shall permanently contain only obscure glass (minimum level 3 obscure glazed) unless the parts of the window that are not obscure glazed are more than 1.7 metres above the floor of the rooms in which the window is installed.   Reason: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties, in accordance with policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2015) and Ealing's Adopted DPD (2013) policies 7A & 7B.
